actor_awards.notes: Leigh won the Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actress and received an Academy Award nomination for her legendary performance in 'Psycho' (1960). She received a Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 1960.

filmography.title: Psycho
filmography.role_description: A secretary who impulsively steals $40,000 from her employer's client and checks into the Bates Motel, leading to cinema's most famous shower scene.
filmography.plot: A Phoenix secretary embezzles $40,000 from her employer's client, goes on the run, and checks into a remote motel run by a young man under the domination of his mother.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actress; Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actress; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#14), 100 Thrills (#1)

filmography.title: The Manchurian Candidate
filmography.role_description: A mysterious and supportive woman who meets Major Marco on a train and helps him recover from his brainwashing trauma.
filmography.plot: An American POW in the Korean War is brainwashed as an assassin for an international Communist conspiracy.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (1994); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Movies (#67)

filmography.title: Touch of Evil
filmography.role_description: The American wife of a Mexican narcotics officer who becomes a pawn in a corrupt police captain's game and is terrorized by local gangs.
filmography.plot: A stark, perverse story of murder, kidnapping, and police corruption in a Mexican border town.
filmography.awards: National Film Registry: Inducted (1993); AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#64)

filmography.title: The Naked Spur
filmography.role_description: The tough companion of a wanted outlaw who finds herself caught between him and the bounty hunter trying to bring him in.
filmography.plot: A bounty hunter trying to bring a murderer to justice is forced to accept the help of two strangers who are less than trustworthy.

filmography.title: Act of Violence
filmography.role_description: The confused and terrified wife of a World War II veteran who is being stalked by a vengeful former POW.
filmography.plot: A vengeful POW survivor stalks the former commanding officer who betrayed his men to the Nazis.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Nominated – Grand Prize of the Festival

filmography.title: Scaramouche
filmography.role_description: A French noblewoman who becomes the love interest of the swashbuckling hero Andre Moreau.
filmography.plot: In 18th-century France, a young man disguises himself as a clown in a commedia dell'arte troupe to avenge his friend's death.

filmography.title: Little Women
filmography.role_description: The eldest and most responsible of the four March sisters, who dreams of a life of luxury but marries for love.
filmography.plot: The four March sisters grow up in New England during the Civil War.

filmography.title: Holiday Affair
filmography.role_description: A war widow and comparison shopper who must choose between a stable lawyer and a free-spirited toy salesman.
filmography.plot: A young widow is torn between a boring attorney and a romantic drifter during the Christmas season.

filmography.title: Angels in the Outfield
filmography.role_description: A newspaper reporter who investigates the sudden winning streak of the Pittsburgh Pirates and their abusive manager.
filmography.plot: A young woman reporter blames the Pittsburgh Pirates' losing streak on their abusive manager, who begins hearing the voice of an angel.

filmography.title: Bye Bye Birdie
filmography.role_description: The long-suffering secretary and girlfriend of songwriter Albert Peterson, who hatches a plan to get a rock star to record his song.
filmography.plot: A rock star's induction into the Army disrupts the life of a songwriter and a small Ohio town.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Sound, Best Music (Scoring)

filmography.title: The Fog
filmography.role_description: The organizer of a coastal town's centennial celebration who must deal with a deadly supernatural fog.
filmography.plot: An unearthly fog rolls into a small coastal town exactly 100 years after a ship mysteriously sank in its waters.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Nominated – Best Horror Film

filmography.title: Halloween H20: 20 Years Later
filmography.role_description: A cameo role as the secretary to Laurie Strode (played by her real-life daughter Jamie Lee Curtis), referencing her role in Psycho.
filmography.plot: Laurie Strode, now the dean of a Northern California private school with an assumed name, must battle the Shape one last time.

filmography.title: Houdini
filmography.role_description: The supportive wife and stage assistant of the famous magician Harry Houdini, played by her then-husband Tony Curtis.
filmography.plot: A highly fictionalized account of the life of the famous escapologist Harry Houdini.

filmography.title: Pete Kelly's Blues
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, thrill-seeking flapper who becomes romantically involved with jazz musician Pete Kelly.
filmography.plot: In 1927 Kansas City, a jazz trumpeter finds his band threatened by a local mobster who wants a cut of their earnings.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actress (Peggy Lee)

filmography.title: Safari
filmography.role_description: An American woman who hires a white hunter to lead her on a safari in Kenya during the Mau Mau Uprising.
filmography.plot: A white hunter leads a safari to find the Mau Mau terrorists who killed his son.

filmography.title: The Vikings
filmography.role_description: A Welsh princess who is kidnapped by Vikings and becomes the object of conflict between two half-brothers.
filmography.plot: Einar and Eric are two Viking half-brothers. The former is a great warrior whilst the other is an ex-slave, but neither knows the true identity of the other.

filmography.title: My Sister Eileen
filmography.role_description: The beautiful, outgoing younger sister of Ruth Sherwood, who effortlessly attracts men in Greenwich Village.
filmography.plot: Two sisters from Ohio move to a basement apartment in Greenwich Village to pursue careers in writing and acting.

filmography.title: Who Was That Lady?
filmography.role_description: A wife who catches her professor husband kissing a student and is tricked into believing he is an undercover FBI agent.
filmography.plot: A chemistry professor tries to win back his wife by pretending to be an FBI agent, but the ruse attracts the attention of real foreign spies.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Motion Picture – Comedy

filmography.title: Harper
filmography.role_description: The estranged wife of private investigator Lew Harper, who has a weary, cynical relationship with him.
filmography.plot: Private investigator Lew Harper is hired by a wealthy woman to investigate the disappearance of her husband.
filmography.awards: Edgar Allan Poe Awards: Win – Best Motion Picture Screenplay

filmography.title: Grand Slam
filmography.role_description: A secretary at a diamond company who is seduced by a thief to get the keys to the safe.
filmography.plot: A retired professor recruits a team of professionals to rob a diamond company in Rio de Janeiro during Carnival.

filmography.title: Rogue Cop
filmography.role_description: A nightclub singer and the girlfriend of a murdered witness, who helps a corrupt cop find redemption.
filmography.plot: A police detective on the take is forced to hunt down his own brother's killer after the mob double-crosses him.

filmography.title: Living It Up
filmography.role_description: A reporter who brings a man supposedly dying of radiation poisoning to New York City for a final fling.
filmography.plot: A station agent in New Mexico fakes a case of radiation poisoning to get a free trip to New York City.

filmography.title: The Black Shield of Falworth
filmography.role_description: A noblewoman and the love interest of a young peasant who is training to be a knight.
filmography.plot: A young peasant is raised as a knight to defeat the black shield of Falworth and reclaim his birthright.

filmography.title: Night of the Lepus
filmography.role_description: The wife of a scientist who helps him inadvertently create a race of giant, man-eating rabbits.
filmography.plot: Giant mutated rabbits terrorize the southwest United States.

filmography.title: Jet Pilot
filmography.role_description: A Soviet defector and pilot who engages in a romance with an American Air Force colonel, though she may be a spy.
filmography.plot: An American Air Force colonel is assigned to escort a defecting Soviet pilot, who turns out to be a beautiful woman.

filmography.title: Walking My Baby Back Home
filmography.role_description: The female lead in a musical comedy about a young man trying to start a band against his family's wishes.
filmography.plot: A young man returns from the army with plans to start a band, but his family wants him to be an opera singer.
